document.title: Doctrinal Elements of a Curriculum Framework for the Development of Catechetical Materials for Young People of High School Age

0F64590EE6764F84BC2DB2348B4685AA.description:
In the Parable of the Widow’s Mite (Mk 12:38-44;
Lk 20:45–21:4), Jesus teaches us that real charity
is measured not by how much one gives but by
the degree of generosity with which something is
given or done for another.

EC1DE6756BA140AEA69775139A5F69BE.description:
No; concern for others is always a responsibility
and characteristic of a disciple of Jesus Christ.

2BF77F65F4104D12BAAA3616F72D638F.description:
There’s an old saying about charity beginning at home.
Doesn’t this mean that I don’t have to worry about
helping anyone else until I have enough to take care of
me and my family?

D5BD3A03DE614190ACD42CC73B29983D.description:
Our sinfulness can only be overcome by Christ’s
salvation (CCC, nos. 619-623).

1B1E998B03064630A868CDD784F27337.description:
The tragic conflicts that still exist in the world
point to the imperfection of human beings (CCC,
no. 2317).

0D325D1ABD53403A8DB3354A67DC8130.description:
We have to remember that God knows, sees, and
understands more than any of us can.

FCE72E02087C4E1A9D2CC9CFAE96F043.description:
It is always important to remember that we are
finite human beings. This means we cannot
know everything and we cannot be in control
of everything.

4632CD7A1D8143D6AC8BC7F15FED5E58.description:
The Church does teach that everyone can and
should make up their own minds about their
actions. The key is that the decision is made on the
basis of an informed or educated conscience. The
Church teaches us what is right and wrong to help
us form our consciences correctly.

763515116E9A4614B6828F245F05B5D4.description:
Why can’t we make up our own minds and be in control
over everything?

080E342A32D8469BB894DE683FFB3796.description:
If every person were to live by a relative moral code
dependent on choice, this would lead to chaos and
a loss of happiness.

31218E10C61F49D7B8B17B5E24A7A4E5.description:
All people have the ability to understand the
Church’s basic moral teaching because God has
written the natural law on the heart of every person
(CCC, nos. 1954-1960).

4BB41824C3BC4A42B6214E7EB907E5F5.description:
Human dignity and the moral code revealed by
God are universal, that is, meant for every person
(CCC, no. 1700).

78B4C6FF3D914B9AA7436CC855BD7531.description:
The Church has the responsibility to teach
everyone as persuasively as possible about what
God has revealed about how people should live, act, and treat each other; fulfilling this
responsibility is not the same as the Church’s
imposing her own views on others. In the
development of public policy, the Church promotes
the universal moral law and the common good, not
her own ecclesiastical disciplines (CCC, nos. 1716-
1724).

7E28F8E0DED0402D9FEF66DB30E5B774.description:
Isn’t it wrong for the Church to impose her views of
morality on others (CCC, nos. 1949-1960)?

078C2F8B589E446797ABC41297D7174C.description:
Objective moral judgment prevents chaos; moral
relativism is a common problem today (CCC, nos.
2488-2492).

100B33A85AAB4D5485BBD2D861034F97.description:
Fraternal correction is an act of charity (CCC, nos.
1793-1794).

EFDA45C825664B33B8D6F534EF46852B.description:
The pressure in society to practice tolerance
toward all, no matter what they do, is a distorted
understanding of what tolerance means; moral
actions must always be measured by truth (CCC,
nos. 2477-2478).

E96BB5594850418AA1B05847BB7FAA2C.description:
The Church reminds us that we are to love
the sinner, hate the sin (Jn 8:1-11; CCC, nos.
1465, 1846).

11489B9ABF96400F8B1D6B690E62DCC9.description:
You would warn friends against doing something
that could harm them; sin harms them more than
physical evil (CCC, no. 1787).

73A11E298ABE4AC7A1643A59E313A3A0.description:
No. We have a responsibility to each other to
encourage one another to live a life free of sin.
To do that, we must remember that sin is real
(CCC, nos. 1849-1869) and be willing to call
what is sinful “sin.”

818B45C86EAA40BEB96D2B576EDB21BD.description:
Isn’t it wrong to judge other people by telling them
something they are doing is wrong?

09B2C5B85C284468B858C563A1158E8B.description:
In reality, sinful acts diminish freedom; moral acts
increase it (CCC, no. 1733).

DC0F9CBE99EF4D78B41A526FD886FA29.description:
Freedom is following the natural law God planted
in our hearts (CCC, nos. 1954-1960).

294DB416ED5641DD9DDECBEDA0B5C866.description:
No. The freedom God gave us is the capacity
to choose what is right, true, and good and
to resist temptation to sin (CCC, nos. 1730-
1742); education for freedom (CCC, nos. 2207,
2223, 2228, 2526). The use of freedom to do
whatever we want is a misuse of that freedom and
actually lessens our freedom (CCC, no. 1742).

BC7DA945F53844C99A28ACA9814C42F0.description:
If God created me free, doesn’t that mean that I alone
can decide what is right and wrong (CCC, nos.
1776-1794, 1954-1960)?

0734ED3C8A814BA982971C944FB3562C.description:
Types of sin: mortal and venial—conditions for
mortal sin (CCC, nos. 1855-1860).

9D893623661D4823BE3F02DC260700D5.description:
Definition of sins of omission and commission
(CCC, no. 1853).

242AF47E4EFD4DD3A9824F6939FFD975.description:
The importance of personal prayer on Jesus Christ’s
teachings (CCC, nos. 2014-2016).

1CF72C32FEF947399B1CB2BABC8E6E49.description:
The importance of regular participation in Mass
(CCC, nos. 1742, 2011, 2014, 2016).

3240568A27CB45CAAB4A4A985970293A.description:
Appropriating and living the moral teaching of Jesus
Christ and his Church (CCC, no. 1694).

402CD71757774EA184A48472BB7D26E5.description:
Sacraments of Holy Orders and Matrimony (CCC,
nos. 1533-1535).

E1E2B1FA77FF4FE5A3428F9C8C1FAFAF.description:
Sacraments and prayer offer us the grace and strength to
live a moral life.

29A7C33357714FA7A5E10458E9A28C68.description:
Moral responsibility of following an informed
conscience (CCC, nos. 1783-1785).

EF8EE2F55301458FAC9D81DB4445F992.description:
The twelve fruits of the Holy Spirit (CCC,
no. 1832).

BAAEDBC144F143BDA302EA4027A6FCED.description:
Seven gifts of the Holy Spirit (CCC, nos.
1830-1831).

066424070779462FB945BBB57BB7DA7D.description: Sustaining the moral life of the Christian.

4B42314F57F94BFBACA5170F2CC5A8F3.description:
Third orders and associates; life in the Spirit (CCC,
nos. 825, 1694).

513CECFFA360470D90436E9C009ECEBE.description:
Consecrated life and societies of apostolic life
(CCC, nos. 914-933).

37111BDC0F1044FCA2F3D2039A17965F.description:
New movements which involve the laity (e.g.,
Focolare; Communion and Liberation).

1460B0D83D4A4A67B664C32B09252F5A.description:
The radical demands of the Gospel for all
believers.

B70CECAB6EB54A498A0A49AAA659324C.description: “Love one another as I have loved you.”

0748317A80564FE9955BDFF302A44FC0.description:
Our vocation—a universal call to holiness as disciples
of Jesus Christ.

AD3FCE6DBC3349318370575206BCD351.description:
God’s love and mercy through Jesus Christ (CCC, nos.
2011, 2196, 2448).

735AF2D2019C480497E04E2C8877422D.description:
Living New Life in Christ Jesus and the
Gospel Message Are the Basis for Catholic
Moral Teaching

FB4103BEBFDB4D799DC2DD2978D68CDD.description:
Church teaching forms one’s conscience for moral
decision making (CCC, nos. 1776-1782,
1795-1797).

ADC11F97BE954434B5D8CF24543F5014.description:
The precepts of the Church (CCC, nos.
2042-2043).

681576A0BEED45B8ACE8E9FC79E4A49A.description:
Canon law (CCC, nos. 736-738; see CCC,
Glossary).

62A461B0C44249C8A6A07CFCBE449C1C.description:
The Church as teacher of moral principles (CCC,
nos. 2032-2035).

FA717CEA66B34928880F2EC2564DD17D.description:
Role of the law in Christian tradition (CCC, nos.
1950-1974).

17D48BE089984A819D4443EEE49B7FBC.description: The Church: her teaching authority and responsibility.

A420DABF7C4D403DAE46BD1935DF89F7.description:
Other teaching.
a) Love your enemies (CCC, no. 2844).
b) Absolute trust in God (CCC, nos.
2828, 2861).
c) Non-violence (defense of innocent)
(CCC, nos. 2306, 2263-2265).
29 Doctrinal Elements of a Curriculum Framework for the
Development of Catechetical Materials for Young People of High School Age
d) Charity to others in judgment and
action (CCC, nos. 1823-1827, 2478).
e) Avoidance of hypocrisy (CCC,
no. 579).

E1FF32C897B44AD9AF9CB8E06DF36896.description:
Beatitudes: Christ’s answer to the question
about happiness (CCC, nos. 1716-1723).
a) Blessed are the poor in spirit.
b) Blessed are they who mourn.
c) Blessed are the meek.
d) Blessed are the merciful.
e) Blessed are those who hunger and
thirst for righteousness.
f) Blessed are the pure in heart.
g) Blessed are the peacemakers (CCC,
nos. 2302-2317).
h) Blessed are those who are persecuted
for righteousness’ sake.

E258BFC0F818418FAD572FF059C222B6.description:
The Sermon on the Mount (CCC, nos.
1966-1970).

62DF17F5ACC746738CDD12AE682AF229.description:
The grace of the Holy Spirit (CCC, nos.
1966, 2003).

25A54FCFC74C47DFB8B687ADEFF3FF76.description:
Second Great Commandment relates to
the rest of the Decalogue.

A53B97DE11FF44459848B4BCB20B71A5.description:
First Great Commandment relates to
the first three Commandments of
the Decalogue.

269CD10627B44395BB7CF0207D78775B.description:
Two Great Commandments of Jesus (CCC,
no. 2083).

835A768A8DF04CF683611CA09489CAAB.description: Teaching revealed by God in the New Covenant.

3D485C9D75FA4B64922FE489FA143FAB.description:
Tenth Commandment: You shall not
covet your neighbor’s goods.
a) Practice simplicity of life and trust in
God (CCC, nos. 2541-2548).
b) Sins to avoid: envy and greed (CCC,
nos. 2535-2540).

DC91AFC9B2B84EEE885582EA4D5E18B1.description:
Ninth Commandment: You shall not
covet your neighbor’s wife.
a) Respect the sanctity of marriage vows
(CCC, nos. 2364-2365).
b) Practice modesty and purity of heart
in thought, words, actions, and
appearance (CCC, nos. 2517-2527).
c) Sins to avoid: lust and pornography
(CCC, nos. 2351, 2354).

A1ADB63590384C91AEBB183F444C3462.description:
Eighth Commandment: You shall not bear
false witness against another.
a) Living and witnessing truth (CCC,
nos. 2468-2474).
b) Sins to avoid: lying, perjury, rash
judgment, detraction, calumny,
boasting, making fun of others (CCC,
nos. 2475-2487). c) Keeping secrets and confidences
(CCC, no. 2489).
d) The responsibilities of the media and
art (CCC, nos. 2493-2503).

147E7B21AFF649AE83F6C3DAD3C4DEC0.description:
Seventh Commandment: You shall
not steal.
a) Right to private property and just
treatment (CCC, nos. 2401-2407).
b) Sins to avoid: theft, keeping
something loaned or lost, the
destruction of the property of others,
business fraud, paying unjust wages,
breaking contracts (CCC, nos.
2408-2418).
c) Overview of the social doctrine of the
Church (CCC, nos. 2419-2449).
d) Economic activity and social justice
(CCC, nos. 2426-2436).
e) Justice and solidarity among nations
(CCC, nos. 2437-2442).

F0BC49B81D64422CBBB9965CC18E84C9.description:
Sixth Commandment: You shall not
commit adultery.
a) Vocation to chastity (CCC, nos.
2337-2350).
b) Offenses against chastity (CCC, nos.
2351-2359).
c) Christian vision of marriage—
theology of the body (CCC, nos.
2360-2379).
d) Offenses against the dignity of
marriage (CCC, nos. 2380-2391).
e) Natural family planning.

9EB1EF1C16E248379E67C9D4C2D14541.description:
Fifth Commandment: You shall not kill.
a) Respect human life in all its stages
and situations (CCC, nos. 2258-
2262).
b) Legitimate self-defense and the death
penalty (CCC, nos. 2263-2267).
c) Principles regarding health, science,
bodily integrity (CCC, nos. 2292-
2301).
d) Sins against the Fifth Commandment:
murder; suicide; abortion; euthanasia;
embryonic stem cell research; abuse
of alcohol, drugs, food, or tobacco;
abuse of the body (CCC, nos. 364,
2268-2283, 2290-2291).

2CA330E8955843A697985283DF03C2F4.description:
Fourth Commandment: Honor your father
and your mother.
a) Obedience in the family.
(1) Context of Christian family
(CCC, nos. 2201-2206). (2) Duties of family members (CCC,
nos. 2214-2231).
b) Duties of civil authority and duties of
citizens (CCC, nos. 2234-2243).

975E788EF1A24AD5B1FA30FF16D78D1C.description:
Third Commandment: Remember to keep
holy the Lord’s Day.
a) Meaning of Lord’s Day (CCC, nos.
2168-2176).
b) Serious obligation to attend Mass
(CCC, nos. 2180-2185).
c) Day of grace—rest from work (CCC,
nos. 2184-2188).
d) Sins against Third Commandment:
missing Mass on Sundays and holy
days (CCC, nos. 2180-2182), failing
to pray (CCC, nos. 2744-2745),
failing to keep holy the Lord’s Day
(CCC, nos. 2184-2188).

CD2AE1FB190645FBB96A2C2D8FEEBD47.description:
Second Commandment: You shall not
take the name of the Lord, your God, in
vain.
a) Reverent speech about God (CCC,
nos. 2142-2145).
b) Sins to avoid: blasphemy or other
abuse of God’s name, perjury,
misusing God’s name in oaths or false
oaths (CCC, nos. 2146-2155).

09243AC5AA654FAAABC4A28FF44841F3.description:
First Commandment: I am the Lord,
your God; you shall not have strange gods
before me.
a) Theological virtues: faith, hope, and
charity (CCC, nos. 2087-2094).
b) Sins to avoid: superstition, idolatry,
divination and magic, irreligion,
atheism, agnosticism (CCC, nos.
2110-2132).

F723CDA79CC7468189E2BEADC075D35E.description:
Teachings revealed by God under the
Old Covenant. •	 Context of the Ten Commandments (CCC,
nos. 2052-2074).
•	 Principle of interpretation (CCC, no. 2083).

F125BADC276F4136BE3FEA2687E4D5DE.description:
Found in all cultures, basis for moral rules and
civil law (CCC, nos. 1958-1960).

B72E8A39B2EB4FACA5CB3633FA232123.description:
Basis for human rights and duties (CCC,
no. 1956).

7775EEEDCFA74AE9986511D39750F5E5.description:
Reason participating in eternal law (CCC,
nos. 1954-1955).

256C38E50F9D46CC963DBAEC7C505EBC.description:
God rules the universe with wisdom and directs its
divine fulfillment (CCC, no. 1719).

DC41D246DE7F4D8099B5D5E1171F099C.description:
God Has Taught Us How to Live a New Life
in Christ

2A288E671AE4422A9BC31F4921CF0232.description: What it means to be a follower of Christ.

F315B50594334C4E8FC272A3355C8ED9.description: He calls us to beatitude or joy.

1F5DAEBF09C543E288F5BEBA91112C37.description:
Endowed with reason, intellect, and free will
(CCC, nos. 1703-1706).

175177ED1CA5459DB4AF6174C38B3D3B.description:
The dignity of the human person (CCC,
no. 1700).

F38BB36CE7774DAEAD0EDD1CBB1D6252.description:
God created us in his image and likeness (CCC,
nos. 1700-1706).

CAA3B091652C4B02A46A220CB84398DE.description:
Jesus Christ fulfills this promise (CCC, nos.
456-460).

2299CDB7A3804192938E3A7E9F023B34.description:
Fall and promise of redemption (CCC,
no. 410).

DDF27270AD51493AAF86FB3BA72589C0.description: Desire and longing for God (CCC, no. 27).

DFD1692EB456448CAD30C7BE188B8F50.description:
God creates us to share eternal love and happiness
with him in Heaven.
